revised_title: Sydney Parkinson's Letter from Batavia to Dr. John Fothergill
tldr: Sydney Parkinson, a young artist and naturalist, writes a letter to Dr. John Fothergill in 1770 from Batavia, detailing the voyages of Captain James Cook. Parkinson discusses their discoveries of land, advancements in astronomy, and successful collection of new subjects in natural history. He also mentions the unfortunate loss of Richmond, a servant of Mr. Banks.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Natural History
